comments.body: Do you really need both? I have been running under Windows so far without JAVA_HOME set to anything (this is how the default JDK installer sets up Java on Windows).
@goderbauer You don't strictly need both but if a user doesn't have a working Java environment I think it's better to give them more direction here.
@goderbauer, do we have to worry about it being java.bat or java.exe on Windows?

As long as this string is executed by the process manager we should be good on Windows (the process manager abstracts away the fact that an executable might have a different extensions on Windows. Looks like this string is passed to `processManager.runSync` below, so we should be good here.
This should be using processManager, or more likely, methods in `base/process.dart`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +180,184 @@    }

    final Process process = await Process.start(
      fs.path.join(androidSdk.directory, 'tools', 'bin', 'sdkmanager'),
      <String>['--licenses'],
